DataElement.preferredName: Radiolabeled Monoclonal Antibody Preparative Regimen Plan Administration Dose Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value related to the dose of the planned radiolabeled monoclonal antibody preparative regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiolabeled Monoclonal Antibody Preparative Regimen Plan Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any compound that has been joined with a radioactive substance._An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment._The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to blood, marrow or cord blood transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur._To devise, contrive, or formed in design._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any compound that has been joined with a radioactive substance.:An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous population of hybrid cells i.e., hybridoma; hybrid cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis and treatment.:The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.

Concepts.definition: Any compound that has been joined with a radioactive substance.

An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment.

The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.

Property.preferredDefinition: Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: . Updated def for prep reg, no version needed. AK 12/20/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The amount of drug administered to a patient or test subject at one time or the total quantity administered. [AMA Manual of Style] (CDISC Glossary)_A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
